item.title: Sarah Everard murder: Met PC Wayne Couzens pleads guilty
item.description: Met Police chief Cressida Dick says "everyone in policing" feels betrayed by Sarah Everard's killer.

item.title: Marked increase in Covid infections across UK
item.description: New infections continue to rise, as England prepares to lift further restrictions.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Covid-19: Infections up by 50% and airport queue warning
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Friday evening.

item.title: Heart inflammation link to Pfizer and Moderna jabs
item.description: But European regulators say the benefits of Covid vaccines continue to far outweigh the risks.

item.title: Djokovic to meet Berrettini in Wimbledon final
item.description: Defending champion Novak Djokovic edges past Denis Shapovalov and sets up a Wimbledon final with Matteo Berrettini on Sunday.

item.title: Euro 2020: England captain Harry Kane on Italy, childhood dreams and Bobby Moore
item.description: England captain Harry Kane hopes to fulfil a childhood dream, while John Stones is full of praise for Raheem Sterling.

item.title: Flooded subways and submerged cars in New York
item.description: Residents shared videos of flooded subways and submerged cars, as Storm Elsa passes through New York.

item.title: Alice Hodgkinson: Body of English teacher missing in Japan found
item.description: Her family said she was "an intelligent, adventurous, confident, caring, young woman".

item.title: Southern Water fined record Â£90m for dumping raw sewage
item.description: The company admits 6,971 illegal spills at 17 treatment works in Kent, Hampshire and West Sussex.

item.title: Scottish politician reported over 'rot in hell' tweet
item.description: The SNP's James Dornan was reportedly replying to the Conservative MP's post about the Nationality and Borders Bill.

item.title: Covid vaccines do work well in clinically vulnerable
item.description: A study of more than a million people shows those with other conditions get high protection from two doses.

item.title: Euro 2020: Three Lions single roars back into UK top 10
item.description: Football anthems creep back into the charts as England prepare to face Italy in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Team GB swimmers 'trolled for our small bums and boobs'
item.description: Olympic hopefuls Izzy Thorpe and Kate Shortman say they've dealt with body-shaming since school.

item.title: Wimbledon: Duke of Kent stepping down as All England Club president
item.description: The Queen's first cousin will present the Wimbledon trophy for the final time this year.

item.title: Mason Mount fan Belle 'won't wash or sell' midfielder's shirt
item.description: Football fan Belle McNally went viral after footage of the player handing her his shirt was shared online.

item.title: Quadriplegic driver makes Goodwood Festival racing debut
item.description: Former IndyCar driver Sam Schmidt was paralysed from the shoulders down in a racing accident in 2000.

item.title: Isles of Scilly: Boat runs aground and balances on rocks
item.description: The two people on board abandoned their boat, which is undamaged.

item.title: RIBA Architects say building demolitions cause of carbon emissions
item.description: There are more carbon friendly options than replacing old buildings with new ones, architects say.

item.title: Euro 2020: Sedgley stem cell donor given final tickets
item.description: Sam Astley, who missed the semi-final to donate stem cells, will now see England v Italy at Wembley.

item.title: Zaila Avant-garde: Teenager makes history at US spelling bee
item.description: Zaila Avant-garde, 14, becomes the first African American to win the high-profile competition.

item.title: Eurovision: Will fans get a Turkish delight?
item.description: Fans have been hoping for Turkeyâs return since 2013, when it left the competition claiming the voting system was âunfairâ.

item.title: Sarah Everard: Daughter, sister, friend and colleague
item.description: Sarah Everard's name became a rallying cry against men-on-women violence. It was not her choice.

item.title: England v Italy Euro 2020 final: No egos allowed makes this England camp different - Rio Ferdinand
item.description: Former England defender Rio Ferdinand says squad depth and the culture Gareth Southgate has created in the camp means he always believed they would go the distance at Euro 2020.

item.title: Val Kilmer documentary is bittersweet say critics
item.description: Val features home footage of the Top Gun star, including him using a voice box post-cancer surgery.

item.title: Gareth Southgate: The England manager - by those who know him best
item.description: As Gareth Southgate prepares for the European Championship final, those who know him best reveal the real England manager.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: 'Everything you should not do, Brazil has done'
item.description: Brazil has the second highest Covid death toll in the world, with pressure growing on its leader.

item.title: 'Farmers can't forget what our grandparents taught us'
item.description: They are looking to older practices to improve meat, boost soil health and mitigate climate change.

item.title: Tired of working from home? Put the office on wheels
item.description: How digital nomads get state-of-the-art connectivity while working on the road

item.title: Ricky Gervais: 'The Office would be cancelled now'
item.description: The show's star reflects on its appeal 20 years on but feels it could now be politically incorrect.

item.title: Olympic Games: The daring escape sparked by one forbidden glance
item.description: At the Atlanta Olympics of 1996, Iraqi weightlifter Raed Ahmed took a huge gamble - inspired by one look from President Clinton.

item.title: Photographer's shopping centre exhibition shows the authentic face of black Britain
item.description: Cephas Williams turns a shopping centre into a gallery for his Portrait of Black Britain exhibition.

item.title: Mark Cavendish equals Eddy Merckx's Tour de France stage win record of 34
item.description: Britain's Mark Cavendish makes history in the Tour de France by equalling Eddy Merckx's Tour stage win record of 34.

item.title: Fury-Wilder postponed after Briton tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: The 24 July trilogy bout between Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder is postponed following a Covid-19 case in the Briton's camp.

item.title: Euro 2020: Best of Micah Richards - Steven Gerrard's borrowed boots feature in pundit's best bits
item.description: BBC pundit Micah Richards tells stories of borrowing Steven Gerrard's boots, his bullet header against Finland and shows off his vocals.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The contact tracing app could be changed to make it less sensitive, so it sends fewer alerts.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: What rights do you have if your holidays plans or rules change?

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch the final?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at the final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 45 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: Fully-vaccinated people in England will be able to avoid self-isolation after travel or contact with a positive case.

item.title: Euro 2020: My dream finish to England's story - Alan Shearer
item.description: Former England captain and BBC Sport columnist Alan Shearer says Gareth Southgate and his side are on the verge of greatness after an amazing month, and reveals his dream finish to Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: How Neil Diamond's Sweet Caroline became an accidental football anthem
item.description: A song written by Neil Diamond 52 years ago has become the England team's unofficial Euro 2020 song.

item.title: Will England's success boost the UK economy?
item.description: The chancellor and others think the tournament could boost consumer confidence as the economy reopens.

item.title: How big will crowd be for final and how can you watch it?
item.description: England will face Italy in the Euro 2020 final on Sunday, but what is the latest ticket situation and how can you watch the game?

item.title: Euro 2020: England victory over Denmark watched by 23.86m
item.description: The Euro 2020 tie was the most watched non-news event since the nation's World Cup exit in 2018.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: Italy v England - pick your Three Lions starting XI
item.description: England stand one game away from winning the European Championship but who would you pick for the final against Italy?
